hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Regime Shift
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC 20-day realized volatility falls below its 100-day rolling 20th percentile (compression) AND the 5-day average daily range is less than 2.5%, the subsequent 5% directional breakout within 5 trading days will correctly signal a new regime (BULL or BEAR) with 70% accuracy, as measured by regime classification over the following 20 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low volatility periods often precede significant directional moves as pent-up energy releases. The combination of percentile-based compression and tight daily ranges filters for true consolidation. A 5% breakout threshold ensures meaningful momentum while avoiding whipsaws.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day realized volatility < 20th percentile of its 100-day rolling window
BTC price breaks above/below the 20-day high/low by >5% on daily close

exit_conditions.take_profit: 20 days after entry (for regime classification validation)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Breakout candle closes back within prior 20-day range
exit_conditions.time_exit: If no clear regime (BULL/BEAR) established within 20 days (neutral classification)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout direction fails to predict subsequent 20-day regime classification in >30% of instances, or breakout success rate falls below random (50%) during stress regimes.
